body.p:
To His Excellency
Thomas E. Bramlette:
Governor of Kentucky:

Your Petitioner would respectfully state that at the Term of the Lexington City Court ^for the year 1864^ he was tried upon a charge of Assault and Battery at the suit of the Commonwealth of Kentucky and fined in the sum of Twenty-five Dollars and costs.
That again at another Term of said Court held for the month of 1864 he was again tried upon a like charge at the suit of the Commonwealth and fined in the sum of Fifty Dollars & costs.

He states that he is a laboring man and has for the whole of the present winter has been confined at home suffering, beside intense and protracted physical pain, a great loss of time from his employment and great expense, that in consequence of these misfortunes he asks that your Excellency remit so much of the said fines as may be within the proper exercise of Executive clemency.
The fees and costs in these cases will be heavy and he respectfully asks a remission of the fines excepting these.
We, whose names are signed hereto would respectfully ask the Governor to remit the fines referred to within as we believe the facts stated to be true --

W T Scott
D. C Wickliffe
F. K. Hunt
J. F. Robinson Jr

City Ct Lexington
